Salary: Salary + Super + Salary Packaging + Monthly RDO
Ad Text:
About the Organisation

Make a real difference in the lives of vulnerable Australians with this unique opportunity to provide both corporate expertise and community support. With a focus on people, not profit, Life Without Barriers’ corporate services team partners with our direct support staff to ensure we continue our mission to change lives for the better. If a truly inclusive, collaborative, and fast-paced work environment sounds like your next career move, this is an opening not to be missed.

Life Without Barriers is a leading social purpose organisation of 8,000 employees working in more than 500 communities across Australia. We support children, young people and families, people with disability, older people, and people with mental illness. We work with people who are homeless and refugees and asylum seekers.  Join a community of people dedicated to breaking down barriers.

We want to employ people who reflect the diversity of our clients to ensure we can support each client's individual needs and wants. We encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background and people with disability to apply.

About this Role

As an AI Platforms Engineer, you will help transform how Life Without Barriers delivers support across Child Youth & Family, Disability & Mental Health and Aged Care services.

In this role, you'll help build the AI and automation capabilities behind a new, mobile first frontline application, designed to reduce administrative burden, surface timely insights and give staff more time to focus on the people we support.\

You will work with cutting edge technologies like large language models (LLMs), orchestration pipelines and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) to create secure, scalable and reusable AI solutions that make a real difference.

This is a 12-month full-time maximum term role. As the organisation explores scaling AI capability, if the role demonstrates clear value to the business, additional funding may be sought to continue building this capability within the organisation. Location is flexible.

Key Responsibilities

Design and maintain AI/ML components including NLP, conversational search and intelligent document automation.
Integrate LLMs and AI services using APIs, orchestration layers and RAG frameworks.
Build reusable AI platforms, prompt libraries and model orchestration pipelines across multiple domains.
Collaborate with developers, data engineers and architects to deliver secure, scalable AI features.
Develop data pipelines for training, fine tuning and inference with strong governance and ethical oversight.
Monitor AI performance, bias, accuracy and drift, implement responsible AI guardrails.
Automate model testing and deployment through CI/CD and align releases with change management policies.
Work closely with UX, product managers and business analysts to shape AI-enabled user experiences.
Liaise with cloud providers and vendors, ensuring cost efficient and flexible AI infrastructure.

Skills & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience delivering AI/ML solutions in production environments.
Strong Expertise in cloud based AI services (AWS Bedrock, Azure OpenAI, SageMaker, etc.).
Demonstrated MLOps experience, including pipelines, model monitoring and deployment automation.
Proficiency in Python and at least one other language (e.g. Node.js).
Solid understanding of LLM techniques (prompt engineering, fine-tuning, RAG).
Familiar with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow, as well as libraries and platforms for LLM development like Hugging Face and LangChain.
Experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases, DuckDB and modern vector databases.
Strong API design and integration knowledge.
Deep understanding of responsible AI principles.
Excellent problem solving, communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

The successful candidate will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check.

Benefits

Opportunity to work for one of Australia's leading social purpose organisations
Make a meaningful impact by empowering frontline workers to spend more time supporting the people who need it most.
Excellent tax benefits and rostered days off
Fitness passport (a discounted health and fitness pass for multiple gyms nationally)

How to Apply

Include your resume and cover letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries relating to the position, Debra Neil contact recruitment@lwb.org.au

Candidates with disabilities who require adjustments to the recruitment process or the application form in an alternate format can visit https://www.lwb.org.au/careers/ for information on our access and inclusion work and how to contact us directly.

Applications close Sunday 12th October 2025

Technical Leadership

Design and deliver pipelines that ingest from multiple vendors and brokers into BigQuery for downstream use.

Partner with the analytics team to create sustainable data products in Dataform.

Monitor and improve pipeline health, setting up alerting and runbooks.

Measure and report on data quality, supported by guidance from the business.

Team Leadership

Manage a team of three (Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Engineer).

Run team ceremonies (stand-ups, planning, retrospectives) and set clear priorities.

Mentor and grow team members' capabilities, holding a high bar for operational excellence.

Conduct performance reviews and ensure delivery standards are consistently met.

Overview

Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.




About the Program: It's a 12-week internship program

Target candidates: Master/PhD students who will graduate between Aug.2026 to Jul.2027​

Target Onboarding Time: Jan./Feb.2026

Location: Brisbane, Sydney




About the Team: 




As Microsoft continues to lead the way in AI innovation, Clipchamp is at the forefront of transforming how people create and share video content. We are the go-to video platform with a simple mission: to empower anyone to tell stories worth sharing. With nearly one hundred million registered users worldwide, we’re just getting started. 


You’ll join a nimble, cross-disciplinary team embedded within Microsoft, working alongside engineers, product managers, designers, and researchers to deliver innovative solutions. If you’re passionate about applying AI in creative, real-world scenarios and want to work at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and storytelling, we want to hear from you.




About the Role: 




As an Applied Science Intern at Microsoft, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working collaboratively to bring research to life in our products and services. You'll gain expertise in cutting-edge research areas, apply advanced concepts to real-world needs, and use state-of-the-art tools to make a tangible impact on product quality and business outcomes. You'll contribute to the creation of intelligent solutions through data analysis, modeling, and machine learning, ensuring our products remain at the leading edge of innovation.

​

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.




Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

​

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Currently pursuing a full-time Master or Doctorate Degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or related field.

Must have at least one additional quarter/semester of school remaining following the completion of the internship.




Responsibilities

Analyze and improve performance of advanced algorithms on large-scale datasets and cutting-edge research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications.

Think through the product scenarios and goals, identify key challenges, then fit the scenario asks into Machine Learning (ML) tasks, design experimental process for iteration and optimization.

Implement prototypes of scalable systems in AI applications.

Gain an understanding of a broad area of research and applicable research techniques, as well as a basic knowledge of industry trends and share your knowledge with immediate team members.

Prepare data to be used for analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data and suggests data to be included and excluded and be able to describe actions taken to address data quality problems.

Assist with the development of usable datasets for modeling purposes and support the scaling of feature ideation and data preparation.

Help take cleaned data and adapt for machine learning purposes, under the direction of a senior team member

About MVSI

MVSI is redefining compliance, risk management, and innovation at a global scale. With operations across Australia, Europe, the US, and Asia, we are a fast-paced, high-growth company driven by precision, accountability, and forward-thinking leadership. Our team is committed to setting new industry benchmarks and delivering impactful solutions. If you’re looking to make a meaningful difference and grow within a dynamic, purpose-led environment—MVSI is where you belong.

Please note:
We are only considering applicants who are Sydney-based and can work onsite (hybrid working available post-probation).

The Opportunity

We are seeking a hands-on Technical Lead to join our newly formed Product Delivery and Platform team. In this pivotal role, you will drive the design, development, and deployment of our next-generation SaaS platform. You will mentor team members, champion engineering best practices, and lead the delivery of robust, scalable, and customer-centric solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Architect and deliver high-performance, scalable systems aligned with MVSI’s development standards.

Promote clean code, automated testing, and scalable software design.

Ensure system integrity, security, performance, and cost efficiency.

Champion a customer-first mindset with measurable, value-driven outcomes.

Mentor developers and cultivate technical excellence across the team.

Collaborate with stakeholders to align technical solutions with business strategy.

Remove blockers, foster innovation, and support continuous team improvement.

Contribute to team reliability and operational support responsibilities.

 Technical Requirements

Minimum 8-years software development experience with commercial TypeScript.

Extensive expertise in the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js),
including Jest for unit testing.

Proven expertise in decomposing monolithic applications into scalable, maintainable microservices, improving agility and performance.

Skilled in building responsive, user-friendly interfaces with React, grounded in UX/CX principles to deliver intuitive and customer-centric designs.

Advanced MongoDB and NoSQL skills, including indexing, performance tuning, and data modelling.

Proficient in secure coding practices and risk mitigation.

Strong RESTful API design, including third-party integrations and adherence to security and compliance standards.

Experience leveraging AI tools to optimize workflows and improve code quality.

Personal Attributes

Proactive, accountable, and solution-oriented mindset.

Open to feedback with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.

Excellent communicator and collaborator, capable of managing stakeholder expectations.

Passionate about mentoring and developing others.

Strong analytical thinker with a focus on customer impact and innovation.

Time-efficient, organized, and supportive of team-wide productivity improvements.

Why Join MVSI?

Global opportunity in Fintech.

Be part of a high-performing, collaborative, and mission-driven team.

Take ownership of greenfield projects with real business impact.

Grow your career in a supportive and rapidly scaling global organization.

We’re looking for an Automation Analyst to join a leading professional services organisation and play a key role in driving process improvement and efficiency through document automation and workflow systems.
What you’ll be doing:

Build, support and enhance document automation and matter workflow systems
Partner with stakeholders to analyse and streamline business processes
Maintain templates, precedents and automation-related reporting (SSRS, PowerBI)
Train and support users to get the most from automation tools
Liaise with external vendors as required
What we’re looking for:

Proven experience with task-based automation and workflow systems
Strong skills in document automation / assembly platforms
Exposure to SQL, SSRS, and PowerBI reporting (desirable)
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement ability
Previous professional services or legal industry experience (advantageous)
What’s on offer:

Hybrid working model with flexibility
Learning & development programs to grow your career
Generous parental leave and purchased leave options
Health, wellbeing and social initiatives
Salary dependent on experience
This is a great opportunity for someone with a process-driven mindset and automation expertise to make a real impact in a supportive, people-focused organisation.

Architects (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Reporting to the Program Director, this role is responsible for developing solution designs which are fit for purpose and encompass all appropriate design specifications to support successful solution build, implementation and operation.

Your key responsibilities will include:

Design fit for purpose solutions that fully encompass the architectural concerns of business, information, application, technology and security domains in alignment with Enterprise Architecture strategies, directives and standards.
Work with Vendors to identify solution capabilities and assure strategic alignment.
Ensure system requirements are sufficiently captured to drive the architecting of a solution that fully meets the needs and expectations of system stakeholders.
Develop documentation including Digital Blueprints, Solution Architecture Documents, Solution Implementation Designs.
Consult, negotiate and communicate with system stakeholders and ICT professionals to promote shared and consistent understanding and acceptance of the proposed solution.
Provide expert advice and communicate solution alternatives, architectural risks, issues and resulting implications.
Contribute in the development of strategic project plans and schedules, including the identification of project risks, issues and appropriate mitigation strategies. 

Is this opportunity for you?

To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate expertise in leading the development of solutions architectures for complex systems as well as your proven ability to evaluate and undertake impact analysis on major architectural solutions and assess associated risks and issues. You will also have proven experience in promoting and ensuring the effective use of solution architecture techniques, methodologies and tools.

Crucially, you will bring a positive and proactive approach to work and be able to work collaboratively within a high performing team. Building effective relationships with key senior stakeholders and decision makers is crucial to your success in this role. You will have exceptional ability to translate this into a comprehensive and efficient business solution and communicate this with stakeholders at all levels and of varying technical ability. You will be confident in consulting, negotiating with and providing high level advice around solution architecture principles, practices and processes to influence decisions on large scale project delivery.

An understanding of clinical systems, including ieMR, pharmacy and or radiology will be highly regarded, with the ability to lead technical discussions and solutions.

You must have sound knowledge of at least one of the following:

Enterprise Applications including Integrations at scale.
Clinical systems and or infrastructure.
Significant server and storage environments including networks.
Data – Data warehousing, migrations and management.
Integrated Electronic Medical Record.

Application authentication solutions and experience with legacy applications will be highly regarded.To apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume along with a brief statement (maximum 2 pages) addressing the "How you will be assessed" criteria outlined in the role description. In your statement, please also highlight your experience with the relevant technologies and applications listed above, providing specific examples of your expertise in any of the key areas.

Benefits of working with eHealth Queensland:

By joining eHealth Queensland, you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success. 

You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
Flexible working arrangements
Diverse work culture
Career training and development

To apply for this exciting opportunity, submit your resume and a short statement (maximum 2 pages) online today.

Should you require additional support or reasonable adjustments during our recruitment process to ensure you can demonstrate your ability to meet the inherent requirements of the role, please contact Talent Acquisition Services via email eQH-DSB-TalentAcquisition@health.qld.gov.au

Ad Text:
Information for applicants

The role is ongoing and located in all capital cities. Information about the position, including eligibility, selection criteria, and details on how to apply, is available on the Bureau of Meteorology's website Careers page at https://bomcareers.nga.net.au/cp/

Applications close at 11:30pm AEDT Sunday 12 October 2025

Enquiries about the position can be directed Alasdair Scott

Project Manager

Email: alasdair.scott@bom.gov.au

About the Bureau

We are Australia’s weather, climate, water, oceans and space weather agency. Our work touches the lives of all Australians every day. 

Our products and services include observations, forecasts, warnings, analysis and advice. They cover Australia’s atmosphere, water, oceans and space environments.

The Bureau operates under the authority of the Meteorology Act 1955 and the Water Act 2007. We also fulfill Australia’s international obligations under the Convention of the World Meteorological Organization and related international meteorological treaties and agreements.

Read the Bureau of Meteorology Strategy 2022–27 to find out more about our organisation and the work we do for all Australians.

Position overview

The Developer – Water Sector plays an integral part in the Bureau's Water Markets Reform program, which aims to improve trust and transparency in water trading across the Murray–Darling Basin. A key responsibility of this program is to develop the digital platforms that facilitate the collection and sharing of national water information. Additionally, the Developer – Water Sector will support the seamless transition of the Water Market Reforms program responsibilities and resources into the BAU operations of the Water Regulations and Standards section and to the Data and Digital Group (DDG).

The role will focus exclusively on the Bureau's water systems and requires an experienced developer with full stack proficiency and strong AWS cloud and applications experience, to maintain system alignment with the evolving Water Act, Water Regulations and Water Market Data Standards. This is achieved through significant industry consultation, regular release cycles and industry wide regression testing. Given the critical role the systems play supporting the Bureau's regulatory functions and obligations and as this position will represent the Bureau in external technical forums, an ability to understand the regulatory framework and the industry, together with operating to the highest standards of reliability, accuracy and professionalism will be required.

Role responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:

Contribute to the detailed design and development of significant elements of new solutions, Web applications, Web services, APIs and databases, with clear documentation on the code produced.
Form a key part of delivery teams to uplift legacy systems and develop integrated digital water solutions incorporating AWS cloud.
Closely collaborate with the Bureau's DevOps and Test specialists to ensure that CI/CD, and Testing are performed according to the Bureau Application Excellence Framework (AEF) development standards and other standards where applicable.
Take responsibility for the performance, quality and testability of code produced.
Collaborate closely with the internal team and external partners to understand and agree deliverables, provide status updates and conduct integrated testing.
Provide support and ongoing maintenance of the suite of water applications.
Communicating concepts and delivering showcases to technical and business stakeholders.
Demonstrating commitment to APS Values, Employment Principles, Code of Conduct and the Bureau's Social Justice Strategy
Complying with all Bureau work, health and safety policies and procedures, and taking reasonable care for their own health and safety and that of employees, contractors and visitors who may be affected by your conduct.

Qualifications:

Mandatory

A degree or diploma of an Australian educational institution, or a comparable overseas qualification, which is appropriate to the duties; OR other comparable qualifications, which are appropriate to the duties.
Demonstrated examples of the development of AWS Cloud services for frontend development such as Cognito, Amplify, AppSync, as well as deployment by AWS CDK.
Proven expertise with:

o            Front-end Languages and Frameworks (Typescript, React, Drupal)

o            Python for backend API development,

o            Relational Database Management Systems specifically PostgreSQL or MSSQL,

o            Version Control (CI/CD Gitlab),

o            Testing (React Testing Library), and

Experience in providing technical input to implement a solution based on the architecture, design and business guidance.

Desirable

Experience with:

o            Power Platform development with an understanding of Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate and Power BI,

o            Networking (firewalls, policies, access control and endpoint security),

o            AWS Cloud services for frontend development such as Cognito, Amplify, AppSync, as well as deployment by AWS CDK.

Professional experience in Commonwealth water agencies, state government water agencies, or other water sector organisations or businesses.
Experience in real-time data processing techniques and message bus technologies.
Experience with microservice architecture.
Experience of DevOps and DevSecOps methodologies.

Merit pool

The selection process will establish a merit pool that may be used to fill similar positions within 18 months.

How to apply

Applications can be lodged through the Bureau of Meteorology Careers.

Your application will consist of resume, contact details for two referees and an ‘800-word pitch’ that considers:

position overview
job responsibilities
selection criteria
relevant sections of the Integrated Leadership System (ILS) and APS work level standards.

The Opportunity

Ventia's Group Supply Chain is excited to offer a newly created Data Engineer role, ideally based in Sydney. This is a pivotal position responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable, high-performance data infrastructure that underpins the organisation's analytics, machine learning initiatives, and core operational capabilities.

As a key enabler of data-driven transformation, you'll play a critical role in converting raw data into actionable intelligence, ensuring data quality, accessibility, and reliability across the enterprise. Your work will empower analysts and the broader data team to deliver insights that drive strategic growth, operational efficiency, and innovation.

This role directly connects data engineering outcomes to business goals, supporting smarter decision-making and enabling product innovation across the supply chain.

What's in it for you?

Competitive salary package
Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance
Work alongside a supportive, experienced, and collaborative team
Access to cross-disciplinary learning opportunities across Ventia's diverse sectors
Ongoing training and professional development to support your career growth
A range of fantastic Ventia employee benefits, including discounted private health insurance, paid parental leave, discounted travel, and more!

Key Accountabilities

Design and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines using modern data stack tools.
Build optimised data models in warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and lakes (e.g., Delta Lake).
Ingest data from APIs, SAP systems, and streaming sources with high integrity.
Automate processes, monitor pipeline health, and ensure performance and availability.
Continuously tune pipelines for efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Architect scalable solutions to support growing data demands.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Stay current with emerging technologies and drive platform enhancements.

Could You Be Our Next Data Engineer?

We're looking for a technically brilliant and forward-thinking Data Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of data in supply chain.

You'll bring:

A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Industry certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics, Google Cloud Data Engineer) are a strong advantage.
Extensive experience in data engineering, with a proven track record of building scalable ETL/ELT pipelines using modern data stack technologies.
Hands-on expertise in AI/ML, Databricks, and cloud platforms.
Familiarity with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).
A portfolio of projects or open-source contributions is highly valued.

Technical Expertise

Programming: Expert in Python and SQL; Java/Scala is a plus for big data frameworks.
Databases: Skilled in PostgreSQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, and Delta Lake.
Cloud: Deep experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP, including services like S3, EMR, Glue, Data Factory, and BigQuery.

Ventia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities. We pride ourselves on working smart, safely and sustainably, harnessing the latest technologies and brightest minds. With a diverse and proud heritage, we have a track record of delivering essential services to the communities in which we operate.

Company
An opportunity has arisen for a control system validation engineer within an exciting organisation. Our technical competency has led us to be a premier automation and control company. As partners with key system suppliers and a substantial customer base we have new requirements to fill roles in pharmaceuticals, water, manufacturing, oil, gas and mining.
 
Role
Reporting to the Control system manager you will have assistance from our lead engineers but would be required to work independently and take on the responsibilities of projects and customers. The role will be interacting directly with our clients and managing these relationships. You would require a personable attitude, willingness to learn, independence and strong problem solving skills to solve and implement control system solutions according to customer requirements. This opportunity's remuneration will depend on experiences and all levels of experience should apply.
 
To be considered for this role you should have:

Tertiary degree qualified or substantial industry experience

Electrical experience is highly desirable

Previous experience with Siemens PCS7, Step 7, TIA Portal, WinCC OA and their other products is highly desirable

Previous experience with Rockwell PLCs and HMIs and their other products is highly desirable

Experience with other control systems such as Schneider, Yokogawa, Emerson and Wonderware is also desirable

Industry experience within the pharmaceutical industry is mandatory

Knowledge of GMP requirements and processes are essential
